review_body: I've always had several dozen different news sources updating me every hour from social media to blogs to my TV(whether I was looking for it or not). And when I found this , it's been a game changer. Espresso gives me critical world updates in a quick 10 minute read. No more,no less. Do you miss out...Full ReviewI've always had several dozen different news sources updating me every hour from social media to blogs to my TV(whether I was looking for it or not). And when I found this , it's been a game changer. Espresso gives me critical world updates in a quick 10 minute read. No more,no less. Do you miss out on some other news ?yes. But honestly there is so much noise this is just the perfect sweetspot . A fantastic way to unplug from the media churning machine and focus.

The app is stuck on April 1, 2020 and we are cancelling the subscription because there is no way to get tech help on the Economist website without paying a service who cannot respond to a question. This is a very disappointing product.

Changes to the format, dropping of the financial market page and in app advertising (despite paying a monthly subscription fee) stack up to make the user experience frustrating. Lack of communication from regional support in regards to these issues is also a bugbear.

Really like the format as an addition to the overwhelming amount of quality read arriving every week. The subscruption is not particularly cheap so it's a mystery to me why you choose to annoy your subscribers with ads even in this app.

its hands down one of the best apps for world news, but the subscription cost is too much , considering that the subscription for the whole magazine is similar priced or even less . please reduce the subscription cost , then it will be hard to beat.

This app has worked flawlessly. I chose the European coverage and I feel so much more informed on International News than I would be if I relied solely on local newsfeeds. Plus it gets right to the point, and gives options for lengthier articles if you are interested by what you read.

as soon as I downloaded and opened I realized that there is no way to continue -- other than reading ONE article -- without giving payment. This seemed like a good idea; however, I refuse to pay for services that also include ads.

Possibly the WORST customer service I've seen lately. Google confirmed my subscription immediately. 3 days later The Economist has yet to respond. The app can find my account, but not the already paid subscription. Customer service can't even find that. Asked for 2 more days to resolve, so I asked f...Full ReviewPossibly the WORST customer service I've seen lately. Google confirmed my subscription immediately. 3 days later The Economist has yet to respond. The app can find my account, but not the already paid subscription. Customer service can't even find that. Asked for 2 more days to resolve, so I asked for a manager. Just to find a manager is another 2 days, AND they are closed on weekends. No wonder print journalism is going down the tubes. Update: 7 days after, manager called back after 4th call.

This app provides the astute, wry and completely sound/unimpeachably relevant kind of content one expects from "The Economist", but...miniaturized? Pocket-sized? Abridged! The experience is scled, but what isn't sacrificed is the caliber of journalism, the impactful insights or the joy of the wit be...Full ReviewThis app provides the astute, wry and completely sound/unimpeachably relevant kind of content one expects from "The Economist", but...miniaturized? Pocket-sized? Abridged! The experience is scled, but what isn't sacrificed is the caliber of journalism, the impactful insights or the joy of the wit behind each bite of news and updates.
Short bursts of daily news, only the gist, very good to start the day.
Great way to start the day, easy to use. Can't wait for the market and monetary info to return.
Love the way a variety of news genres are delivered in bite size portions.

The Economist Espresso app is a quick reading of a summary of the World News. The review is magnificently executed with critics and opinions in a short report. I enjoy the daily quote as well. The previous days review also is accessible with a touch.

I used to subscribe to the Economist but it came too often for me to really finish. The espresso app solved that for me. Every day I get caught up in 5 minutes with the global breadth of the Economist. Fantastic.
Excellent morning round-up of the day's international news. The app. works very well, with only two minor glitches in over two years of use. Quick restart resolved both.
Good daily summary. Good addition to the newspaper which I enjoy. They keep me informed.

I have a digital subscription to the Economist, but can never login to Espresso. I contacted The Economist to ask for help. They said I don't have a subscription. I asked the lady why do I have a credit card statement showing that I've been billed several hundred dollars by The Economist and my phon...Full ReviewI have a digital subscription to the Economist, but can never login to Espresso. I contacted The Economist to ask for help. They said I don't have a subscription. I asked the lady why do I have a credit card statement showing that I've been billed several hundred dollars by The Economist and my phone downloads the magazine weekly. She had no answer. I blame BoJo and Brexit.

An amazing app for staying up to date with world events. Furthermore, the newsbites are convenient to read on the go and when having little time to spare. Unfortunately it contains ads which should not be the case after paying for a subscription.
The length and number of articles are great for a daily update. And being "rewarded" with the daily quote if you read all the articles is a fun touch. The app is also very reliable.
Sorry just put the fact that it's 30 days then subscription fee (which isn't listed anywhere clearly) front and centre please.

Great, quick update of the daily news from around the world. Perfect length articles for a read with my morning coffee. A good partner to the Economist magazine, which obviously requires more time to read.

Very well written news and perfect if you want to stay in touch with the world but don't have that much time to dedicate to it. There are a couple of errors now and then, but they are always addressed in the next editions.

Very concise summary of news from a global perspective. There's one ad in every edition but it's easy to swipe past. PS: Economist, please fix your Chrome app! It hasn't worked since the beginning of September.
Really enjoy the bite sized way to read news, concise but complete at the same time. Open the mind to new subjects and topics in a way that isn't overwhelming.
Excellent bite size news digest, quick and easy to keep updated on global current affairs.
Great format, great coverage. But please do more proofreading - sometimes there are too many typos for such a reputable source
By far, the most authentic and complete coverage of news and world events. Outstanding
Great app to just catch up on daily news. While its articles are shorter, it still possesses the writing quality of The Economist. I strongly recommend it in complementary of the real app.

Simple and intuitive, and the content is exceptional (although does every short story need a witty ending?). As a paying customer it's somewhat strange to be forced to swipe past an ad on the second screen every day.
Great for the supermarket checkout line. Summary of news carefully curated by excellent journalists. Six or so brief stories per day. I just wish there were a little more content.
Great accompaniment to coffee, as the name applies. I like the focus on international headlines. App works very well and has a good interface. Quality.
I thoroughly enjoy reading the bitesize amounts of relevant news articles each day. I feel that I'm ablr to keep up to date with the major issues. I also like the quotes at the end.
Very handy and I think reliable overview of what it's going on that matters.
The articles on the app, are veeery short, if that isn't a problem for you, the app is great and very easy to use. If you already have a full subscription to the economist it makes a lot more sense
easy to use, provides interesting news topics, easy to read, comes with a brief description section on other topics, nice quote of the day in the end.

The first thing I do every morning. Today's news in brief gives an overview of events that can be looked afterwards in more detail. A good start for the day and doesn't take a lot of time to read.
Love the app platform. Provides me with an easy swipe of curated news. The Economist itself is wonderful and reassuring to read for its careful analyses and, many times, impartial nature.

Great simple app for a morning coffee companion. There is a recurring technical glitch that prevents it from loading some days. It times out trying to load the current edition on a high speed internet connection.
This app is fantastic. The Economist's subscription is worth it just because of this.
I love the idea of this app. But the content is extremely brief and not what I'd expect from the economist. It almost takes longer to open the app then it does to read the brief article.

Great app and one of my favorite parts of having an Economist subscription. That said, very annoying to be served ads after already paying for a service. Pick one - ads or subscription. Both is greedy.

EXCELLENT. Long time subscriber, former analyst I can say that the Economist itself is professionally objective with credible and proven analysis. Long time subscriber, former analyst I can say that the Economist itself is professionally objective with credible and proven analysis. Yes, a bias to capitalism, but expressed, not hidden. The audio Economist helps with a busy schedule, but even that takes time. THIS APP provides a quick "morning briefing" and head's up.

Not overloaded with content. Just enough to give me a daily dose of key items and whet my appetite to read more when I have time at hand. Good job team Economist. One suggestion though - should this really require a different app?

Great selection of news, brief, but not watered down, just the essence, elegantly written. An excellent companion to the morning coffee.
Good to get world news in a condensed format. I check espresso in the morning and feel a little bit more informed before I start my day. Only issue I have sometimes is getting the stories to swipe.

Great app! Wish there was an audio version each day as well
The news "espresso" is really good. You get a broad world view everyday but sunday and you can read from other regions too. Though i dont like seeing ads in a paid subscription.
Great quick summary every morning. Keeps me up to speed with world headlines.
An absolute must for anyone following the world but having only ten minutes or less to do so in their busy schedule.
top notch content as you would expect and the app is stable and intuitive. It sometimes takes a bit too long to download the latest edition but that's a minor issue.
Good but prone to technical failures with updating content.

Succinct, pointed, and relevant news. A daily news app, updated every 24 hours and which includes only about 6 or 7 stories, and a daily briefing. Very useful in today's world of information overload.
Very useful, and a nice way to catch up on what's happening in the world each day. Not too much information and not too little. Also, the app is visually appealing and runs very smoothly.

Love the brief, and accurate reporting. it's a good way to stay on top of the news without listening to all the rhetoric from other media outlets.
My daily dose of news before i get out of bed! Espresso is crisp and well written. it conveys the news without bias stating facts as good journalism should. its a breath of fresh air
The daily news briefing is succinct and easy to use. It's valuable to always be up to date in the morning without taking the time to sort through a jumbled news site.
The content is relevant, timely and seemingly independent, though at $6.99 per month, that is a little steep compared to other subscriptions, given there is so little content.
This application gives me an overall summary of world events and helps me get informed about current trends as well. Very manageable info, a good read to start the day.

Great app for daily updates. Nice and pithy. Love the quotes at the end. Only recommended improvement would be to include optional tracking of specific stocks.

Was craving to have Espresso on my phone because i had heard a lot about it. I subscribed recently and got this app now. What a wonderful app.. Superb content presented nicely to be consumed while sipping the coffee. Wow...
A handy app to keep on top of major stories. slightly frustrating that it still contaims so many adverts for what is after all a paid platform.

Quick and informative
This is a really helpful app. I'm unsure why is is charged for as it is good PR and advertising for The Economist. This may stop me using it long term.
Great news recap of main stories around the world. Goes well with commute, a cup of coffee or beverage of your choice.
Still the best short read daily briefing for a global perspective, put out by The Economist, which produces arguably the best balanced in-depth reporting on the planet.
love this app! so quick and easy to use and some great updates. I'd reccomend this to anyone looking for a bitesized update on the world in the morning.
Easy to use, clean, and good snippets.
An excellent companion for the morning coffee
Great app for a daily dose of the Economist! I feel better informed during my commute to see what I missed the night before. If you subscribe to the Economist, you must get this app!

Great app and insight with a fact based worldview. Highly recommended

I've enjoyed these quick, daily updates that are typically the useful information devoid of partisanship, at least as an US citizen.

was a five star app until the markets page was "suspended for maintenance" in April. It's now July and still no markets page. How much maintenance can there be? Where's the update reinstating that page?

Solid news summary to start the day.
The choice of incidents are emblematic of important trends. The language is crisp and puts the incident in context.
Interesting and succinct style. The content isn't always ready at the start of each day which is a bit annoying.

Great asset to get updated on the key happenings around the globe. And the length of the articles is just right so you can cover a range of topics. Full marks!

Super informative!!! Not the most neutral but interesting facts and concise information

great review for the day. Allows for interesting conversation starters throughout the day as well.

couldn't use without opening an account and then payment would start automatically unless I remembered to cancel. did not like that idea.

Perfect companion app for the Economist, but I would also recommend as standalone, even if that's not how I use it.

Critical news in a nutshell, and written with humor and erudition. What could be better!

very concise, great onformation, helpful tips and tricks if you read between the lines.

Well, The Economist has finally succeeded where other news organizations have failed by getting me to subscribe. Espresso is 5 short news summaries of important stories from around the world, often government or business focused, and a handful of one paragraph bite sized pieces. It gives me a broad ...Full ReviewWell, The Economist has finally succeeded where other news organizations have failed by getting me to subscribe. Espresso is 5 short news summaries of important stories from around the world, often government or business focused, and a handful of one paragraph bite sized pieces. It gives me a broad perspective, makes me feel smart and well informed, and can be read quickly on the bus or while eating. If you're in the fence, download the app and try their one article a day free version. See how long it takes you to upgrade to the full trial.

end) to one's day. With tie-ins to related articles from the Economist 
archives and an efficient format familiar to regular readers of that 
publication, it is both an extension and standalone offering whose 
insights, irreverence and inspiration are a keen companion for a quiet 
moment that can enrich most any day. After years of reading, I still find 
it a delight cannot recommend it strongly enough. Other publications have 
since adopted a similar offering, and with good reason.

Should have read the summary closer - you can read one article a day unless you are a pay subscriber. Not sure this should enable them to call themselves free - except in a very liberal interpretation of the meaning. Uninstalling of course.

A full read through takes about 10 - 15 minutes - great for reading on the 
train or bus. Gives a nice high-level overview of yesterday's news, and 
frequently has links to full Economist articles. Has a lot of nice 
international content, great for the American reader trying to stay 
informed globa...Full ReviewA full read through takes about 10 - 15 minutes - great for reading on the 
train or bus. Gives a nice high-level overview of yesterday's news, and 
frequently has links to full Economist articles. Has a lot of nice 
international content, great for the American reader trying to stay 
informed globally.
Quick download, well-written, and gives a great busride breakdown of the day's international headlines. Great for keeping up to date between significant pieces.

Quick way to grab basic headlines plus brief stories on news which other mainstream outlets don't focus on. It's also very nice how most of the stories don't revolve around Trump as many outlets (US ones) get tiring with such focus.

Very well presented and bug free app up to now (touch wood!). Read this daily on my Nexus 7 tablet. Also subscribe to economist digital mag and read on this tablet and that is also very well presented and professional.

Very underwhelming. Short articles with little or no insight. Links to further reading may be where the action is at but they don't work for me. Fortunately I'm on a free trial which I've cancelled. People pay for this rubbish?

This is the first news app I open on the morning. Gives me a crisp, quick perspective on the world with the added bonus of the Economist's dry wit.  Technically, it's OK to take a moment to load - no need for a routine "something''s wrong" message as that happens
I can rarely find the time to read the newspaper itself, but The Economist's morning briefing app fits into my morning perfectly. Maybe they should make a separate subscription for only this ;)

Liked it till I started getting the error 'Something has gone wrong...' and 
it stopped updating news for the day. I fixed it once by reinstallation but 
can't do that every day.

Meh. The brief descriptions are what you might expect from a passing water cooler conversation with a co-worker. There really is no valuable insight for someone who doesn't live in a cave of isolation.
Great news summary, but not 5 star because of a few technical glitches requiring reinstall, I think problems occur on slow connections.
I recently started to use this app again, after a period of absence from it. it's concise, and interesting. I think this time I'll continuously use it first thing on the morning!

I really enjoy Espresso, very easy to navigate with just a few swipes, the 
whole experience is neat and tidy. Content is excellent, brief summaries of 
world news and market information, great way to start your day.
5 briefs (1 paragraph) on worldwide goings-on,  about 5 ultra briefs (one sentence), and financial market stats each weekday in Economist fashion--terse, pithy, witty, incisive.
This is a very dense, thoughtful collection of news nuggets delivered every morning to my inbox. Always interesting,  wide-ranging, easy to consume. Bravo Expresso!

The content of this app is supurb. It is often unavailable due to technical 
problems.
In an increasingly crowded and noisy news whirlwind, espresso delivers consice dose od daily updates with a few smiles and Economist inspired insights.
I love that it links you to past articles written on the same subject. There is a limit of those you can read before you have to upgrade, but by then, this app has proved it is worth it to do so.
I couldn't dedicate the time to a larger digest, but this highlight reel of the world at large has been super enjoyable, worth the subscription, and a ritual part of my morning espresso.

Perfect start of the day, allowing you to keep informed about the current 
world affairs. Useful if you don't have a subscription, too!

I have been reading the Economist for years. While I like my magazine in 
physical format; this is a nice little daily snippet of news. It drink my 
espresso in the morning while reading this- so I would say this app is 
aptly named.
Comprehensive while compact overview of latest news. Nice touch to announce some important events yet to happen during the day. Great companion to the full Economist app.

One of my favourite apps. I use it often an find it a brilliant source for accurate and unbiased info. I use it often and find the layout so simple and sooth. The stories are always informative and interesting. Well worth subscribing to!

A great way to stay informed on my morning commute. Since I work in finance it's nice to have a look at what is going on with the market. A lot of the regional stories and the World in Brief section help me plan accordingly.
Quick, daily updates on what's happening. Not a lot of detail but for a quick overview it's invaluable, especially explaining it in a straightforward, 'plain English' way

Being new to Espresso and still in the "try" phase of a subscription, I have yet to make a final judgement. However, a pleasing start with good news sample selections and, important to me, this news service is intelligently conducted without being intrusive.
The 6 top things you need to know at the start of your day is delivered right through the app.

Highly, and effectively condensed snapshot of global affairs. I appreciate each story having a footer referencing a more developed economist article. Also, the daily quotations are a nice touch and sometimes feature the characteristic economist humor.

Have enjoyed the Economist magazine for 30+years but found myself with

Enjoy reading analysis and commentary of current and less prominent topics.

The newspaper itself is good, but should you ever want to cancel your subscription, be prepared for (1) not having an option to cancel on their website, (2) your email requests being ignored repeatedly, (3) being asked to call a UK number for a US based customer, and (4...Full ReviewTerrible customer service!!   The newspaper itself is good, but should you ever want to cancel your subscription, be prepared for (1) not having an option to cancel on their website, (2) your email requests being ignored repeatedly, (3) being asked to call a UK number for a US based customer, and (4) your subscription being auto-renewed at intransparent rates without prior notification. As of writing this review, I have now been trying to cancel my subscription for months without success.   Sad to see that an otherwise great newspaper so sorely lacks in customer service! Stay away from subscribing.   Free digital access can be had though many libraries.

A great way to start the day I enjoy starting the day reading Economist Espresso. Opening Google News or other free news aggregators gives me far too much sensational and narrow material engineered to get page views. Economist Espresso covers global issues and doesn't  focus narrowly on whatever I happened to have been looking ...Full ReviewI enjoy starting the day reading Economist Espresso. Opening Google News or other free news aggregators gives me far too much sensational and narrow material engineered to get page views. Economist Espresso covers global issues and doesn't  focus narrowly on whatever I happened to have been looking at in the past. I quite like that it's not tailored to whatever I view on the web.

I have lived and died by The Economist... As a former CEO of a multinational  corporation, The Economist helped me keep my finger on the pulse of the world's economies. Having retired has not kept me from "ingesting" The Economist, however the format. It doesn't seem like long ago that if I happened to be traveling when the new issue was de...Full ReviewAs a former CEO of a multinational  corporation, The Economist helped me keep my finger on the pulse of the world's economies. Having retired has not kept me from "ingesting" The Economist, however the format. It doesn't seem like long ago that if I happened to be traveling when the new issue was delivered by the mailman, I would scour the various airport lounges where more often that not, it was where I could find a copy of an issue. Things have sure changed, not The Economist. Thank goodness.

Nice concise morning read, with flaws I read Espresso just about every morning, so it is doing something right. I like the polished delivery and graphic design. However, it's a resource pig. On a 5 year old device it was slow, failed sometimes, and took way too much storage. On a more current, powerful device it's still a pig, but the d...Full ReviewI read Espresso just about every morning, so it is doing something right. I like the polished delivery and graphic design. However, it's a resource pig. On a 5 year old device it was slow, failed sometimes, and took way too much storage. On a more current, powerful device it's still a pig, but the device can carry it. The new videos are a laudable experiment, but not yet good. So far the only content is "talking heads", which prose delivers more efficiently. They should use video to deliver visuals.

Informal, concise and blunt From time to time a 2 sentence espresso article has, through concise and blunt text, been more informative and truthful than full articles (that by nature give more perspective than is sometimes necessary, or truthful). The rest of  the time it provides a soberingly newsworthy collection of articles...Full ReviewFrom time to time a 2 sentence espresso article has, through concise and blunt text, been more informative and truthful than full articles (that by nature give more perspective than is sometimes necessary, or truthful). The rest of  the time it provides a soberingly newsworthy collection of articles that are relevant that day. Concentrates on news that deserves analysis rather than arouses emotion (and often the lack of analysis). Still, insufficient as only or primary news source.

Good app The espresso is informative and eclectic. It notified me of a new museum exhibit that was opening that day at the Victoria and Albert, so I went and had a great time. It notified me of a new museum exhibit that was opening that day at the Victoria and Albert, so I went and had a great time. The daily watch doesn't work for some reason on my old android phone and the app itself takes a while to load, despite the daily articles being relatively small compared to the other documents that I download.

It's ok but some niggles Content is good but interface not quite right. I would prefer it if I could select different days on the screen without going to settings. It should really cache multiple days. Perhaps a setting to cache a week or two weeks or a month or forever? And automatically download on WiFi without prompting.

Crisp round-up of world events Although I almost daily use Espresso but it uses a huge amount of data to load and sometimes when I don't get enough bandwidth, it shows the previous day's news. I wish developers will lower application's data consumption or atleast streamline it.

Deathly slow The daily summaries are nice, but this app takes over 15 seconds to load (after a notification said it was "ready"). Linked articles don't take you to Economist app. Effort on this could have been spent making the real app better for subscribers.

Great for a quick update Really like the app, and the quick info bites. The only thing I find frustrating is that at times I see the try again later dialogue, sometimes many times in a row. It happens on wifi and data, so it seems to be an issue with the app or the Economist. Otherwise, great for daily rundown.

Brilliantly concise Far better than long winded articles, but best of all succinct and concise enough to summarise major developments in the world.  Only suggestion is the ability to swap exchange rates to convert from one to the other without calculating the reverse.

As I understand, it was released but a week ago.  [Ed: The following is all still true two years on.] The time to open in the morning is absurdly long. Keep up the Good Work I know the team has been working to solve some issues. Not quite there all the time, but close.

The Espresso provides a concise news briefing for the time-strapped. Each edition can literally be read in the time you drink your espresso. I especially enjoy two features:  1) The world in brief section -- the real reason why I downloaded the app in the first place. A quick overview of the world t...Full ReviewThe Espresso provides a concise news briefing for the time-strapped. Each edition can literally be read in the time you drink your espresso. I especially enjoy two features:  1) The world in brief section -- the real reason why I downloaded the app in the first place. A quick overview of the world today;  2) Kal draws... -- this is not available in every edition, but every now and then the Espresso offers a short cartoon explaining the basic stuff, such as inflation and taxation.  There are twp reasons why I didn't rate Espresso as excellent, and these may be unfair. Anyway:  1) No Espresso on Sundays! 2) Not enough news about the Philippines (granted, this is entirely unfair).  Otherwise a wonderful app. In my country it costs me about the same as a large cup of Starbucks coffee per month. I think it's totally worth it.
Nice way to stay the morning It is a bit buggy, but they're fixing it. And I really do love starting my day with coffee and Espresso.
A clear and clean interface for news No fancy bells and whistles, just the news in short straight to the point shots. Just like my Espresso.

Doesn't work unless you have a REALLY good Internet connection It often says that it can't download the articles. It has to re-download every time I change the day. I'm getting tired of fighting it - a huge waste of time! Defeats the purpose of "espresso".

Long time reader and fanatic of the Economist While I do greatly love and appreciate the weekly Economist newspaper and have been a subscriber on several occasions in the past, unfortunately I just don't have the time to read it on a weekly basis. It's difficult to stay informed and updated on international news and affairs. I feel the Economis...Full ReviewWhile I do greatly love and appreciate the weekly Economist newspaper and have been a subscriber on several occasions in the past, unfortunately I just don't have the time to read it on a weekly basis. It's difficult to stay informed and updated on international news and affairs. I feel the Economist Expresso is the perfect app for people such as myself who wish to sharpen and enlargen their world view while restricted for time. Keep up the great work.

It is what it is supposed to be... ... a trimmed down "express" version of The Economist for the current day. Sometimes I wish I could navigate to previous dates but can live without that feature. I would not pay for this app on its own, but will happily take it as part of my regular subscription.

Almost perfect, but missing some features Very nice app, love the quick summaries. However, it would be nice to have audio of the text like the regular economist app. It's also missing the ability to speed up video playback, and the screen does not lock on while watching full screen video, and will eventually timeout. The content is great, ...Full ReviewVery nice app, love the quick summaries. It's a nice light way to start the day As always, the writing is superb in publications of The Economist.  The articles are topical. But I don't think they are incisive enough to be truly Espresso.   They are more like Dunkin Donuts coffee. I do read the articles most mornings, however.

The only app I use daily. I love waking up to this Espresso. The content is crisp (crisper since some time ago when the Espresso writers had a run off). The aesthetics, the ease of use and the daily quote of course! All brilliant.
Overall great reporting ...though the socialist, anti-Trump orientation significantly detracts from the value of the questionable information presented.

On the other hand, it is nice to have a mobile app that is short and concise.  I like that the Economists' information delivery system is dynamic and evolving.
Enlightening easy to navigate. clear concise articles. great range. also, the "daily watch" segment offers an insightful 3-4 min video on divisive issues. excellent news briefing overall.

Simplicity at its best For those who like to cut through long-winded articles, this is the app for you. I personally don't have the time to read a lot of news everyday during the week. This app provides a great solution with single paragraph articles on interesting world events.

Excellent reporting, exquisitely delivered. If you're looking at this review, you're obviously interested in The Economist's perspective and style, so I won't belabor that point. What I want to emphasize is how wonderfully put together the app is. Each day, you get a convenient agenda. You can tap into any article, but I prefer to read it fro...Full ReviewIf you're looking at this review, you're obviously interested in The Economist's perspective and style, so I won't belabor that point. What I want to emphasize is how wonderfully put together the app is. Each day, you get a convenient agenda. You can tap into any article, but I prefer to read it from bottom to top. Each page is a succinct update, accompanied by a vibrant photo. They wrap up with The World in Brief, which is exactly what it sounds like, followed by a market snapshot. Fantastic.

This isn't particularly satisfactory esp. for a paid app. Other than that it is pretty neat.

I should just get a sub to the economist mag really - but with limited ...Full ReviewWhat's probably more annoying for me (as a cheapskate with the free edition) is the headlines are often cryptic, trying to he witty. I should just get a sub to the economist mag really - but with limited time I'd love to have a proper digest of the *important* stuff.

Why wait until I ...Full ReviewTake one of the greatest news analysis machines in the world and have it produce a daily news briefing - excellent idea. However, as with the weekly magazine, the application that delivers the content has its issues. For one, I am obviously going to read it front to back every day. Why wait until I click the notification to download the content? The wait and sometimes inability to download is a real nuisance. No choice for the delivery vehicle, so I have to accept that. Still love the content.

Brevity, brilliance, breadth. Brief stories covering wide breadth of world political and economic issues, and brilliantly intuitive design. Excellent for those with busy mornings but 5 min here and there to catch up on world events.

Excellent. Quick and informative daily briefing on world news I think I enjoy the Economist's Espresso app's daily news updates more than I like reading their magazine (which I love). Content is tops and the layout and design is smooth and modern. Good work!

Pretty, clean, and compact All the journalistic quality of the full magazine shrunk for easy digestion. Ads don't get in the way of viewing. Stories regularly recieve follow-up in following days; a refreshing respite from mainstream media.
Amazing news from an amazing source Something I would add, though: on the exchange rates and commodity price page, a graph showing the context of the changes when you tap on them.
Helps me stay informed I'm not a huge news fan but love the Economist.  This ap is a great daily mini version of the magazine. Interesting stories and nice ap.
Great app The app is easy to use and has a great design. It gives me the top stories from around the world in a short amount of words.  That's perfect for a quick catchup on the world.
ads even when you pay for the subscription? Thought this would be a nice addition to my morning coffee but I'm not going to pay for an app that still contains ads...

What's the incentive? Pointless After installing this the app told me I could read one article a day. I think it meant I could read one ABRIDGED article a day. And by abridged I mean one paragraph. Basically you need to pay to read any of the content. I could be interested in paying a small fee but since I have no idea what the co...Full ReviewAfter installing this the app told me I could read one article a day. I think it meant I could read one ABRIDGED article a day. And by abridged I mean one paragraph. Basically you need to pay to read any of the content. I could be interested in paying a small fee but since I have no idea what the content is, what's the point? There's no incentive to try. You can opt for a 30 day trial, but that means subscribing via your Google account. At this point you learn it's ¬£2.49 a month fee. Too much for me.
Excellent daily capsule A very crsip summary of the main events and happenings around the world. Unfortunately Norton anti-virus flags it as "medium risk" on data usage.

All of the Economist's pithiness compressed into a 5 minute read Five minutes everyday and you not only get the Economist's classic style of journalism, but you're also caught up on what's going on in the news. Love the app and the quote at the end!

Easy and clear! The app is incredibly easy to use and the interface is awesome, very clear to read. I appreciate the fact that past issues are deleted each day - you can read only today's issue. And the golden key is the end with witty quotes - philosophers, scientists, and even boxers.

OK with subscription Works reasonably well with a subscription, providing a brief snapshot of Economist content 6 days a week. It is usually slow to load on the various devices and internet connections with which I've tried it.
Good Shots I like the attempt to reshape thoughtful news delivery. Would rate higher for fair value. Restricting access to full articles referenced is pure money grab for full economist subscription.

Eclectic excellence I've got into the habit of reading my Espresso practically every day and I enjoy the short, snappy news clips from across the world. Not every article grabs my attention, but it is easy to swipe to the next page and move on. Definitely worth a try.

Great way to keep up to date Often times I don't have the luxury of reading the entire issues of The Economist, but this user-friendly app really makes a quick daily read in the morning an easy task. I especially like that if I wish to read the full-length article I only need to click on a link within the Espresso version.
Fails to update But when it eventually does, contents are really good. A historical graph when tapping any of the economic indicators on last page, would be a welcome addition.

Highly recommend This app is the perfect mix of 1-2 sentence news stories to wake up to in the morning. While never losing the Economist's plucky style of reporting, I can choose the news which is local to wherever I am in the world when I travel as well. The technology works without fail to deliver content at 0530 ...Full ReviewThis app is the perfect mix of 1-2 sentence news stories to wake up to in the morning. While never losing the Economist's plucky style of reporting, I can choose the news which is local to wherever I am in the world when I travel as well. The technology works without fail to deliver content at 0530 every morning.
Just Right Perfect for a quick read every morning.  I like the variety of the main stories. The brief, markets and quote are great too. The app works well.  Problems are rare.

Indeed the best way to start the day A nicely compressed way of getting the highlight events of the day within the first five minutes of every morning. I'm a huge fan of The Economist newspaper but, when I don't have the time to read it fully, the Espresso is a really good alternative

Great content and good app Espresso is a great way to start the morning with a few highlights from around the world, and helpful commentary on why they should matter to me. It covers a lot of ground in a couple of short articles (I should mention I subscribe to the Economist).   I would give 5 stars if I could use the app off...Full ReviewEspresso is a great way to start the morning with a few highlights from around the world, and helpful commentary on why they should matter to me. It covers a lot of ground in a couple of short articles (I should mention I subscribe to the Economist).   I would give 5 stars if I could use the app offline. It would be a great subway read on my way to work.

10 minute read in the bus This app is quite convenient, I can read it in the bus every morning and get a summary before the weekly edition. It's sometimes a bit slow in loading but otherwise very easy to use.

Good except exchange rates Good content but I wish the exchange rates would show GBP to foreign currency consistently rather than the other way round or foreign currency to foreign currency. Also would be nice to have additional trend data on stock market data rather than just change since day before (e.g. Inline 7-day moveme...Full ReviewGood content but I wish the exchange rates would show GBP to foreign currency consistently rather than the other way round or foreign currency to foreign currency. Also would be nice to have additional trend data on stock market data rather than just change since day before (e.g. Inline 7-day movement chart)
Espresso A bit reluctant to load on slow connections. Otherwise useful stories, that also appear later in the Economist, and with a quick glimpse of the markets.

Not bad, but don't really have a good Asian edition Too little coverage for Asia, even when it's the Asian edition. We have Southeast, East, and North Asia, but in average the coverage is only less then a third of total articles. Otherwise it's basically a very good app.
I  renewed my subscription about a month ago and it doesn't recognize it. Poor.     Update Jun 27/16: running way more smoothly. Five stars.
Excellent content; app improvable Great daily feed. Would value one in the evening too. App not always great without WiFi.

Quick top world news, first thing Since its release I've been reading/skimming Espresso with the first few sips of my home made espresso. Aptly named. Sure to be the top world news of the day. Clean design, innovative app.

A simple and succinct app Just as the title suggests, this app is simple and succinct to use and to read. Just enough to provoke thought and curiosity to explore further if one wishes. Navigation is as easy as it gets with content clearly laid out for consumption.
Perfect bite-sized news This app is really nicely designed and easy to use, and I like the news it delivers.
My cup of tea in the morning Great news app that gives you a 10-15 min read breakdown of current events and some mini The Economist style essays.
Good articles but.. One paragraph a day. To read any more, they ask for your money haha.

Superb! Look forward to start my day with the Espresso App. A concise yet insightful collection of stories to keep up to date even with the most busiest of schedules.   The UI is simple but eloquent, with great ease of use. Staying with the high standard set of Economist Apps
Informative. Quality. Excellent source of high quality articles undiluted by the trend in modern news to focus on the trivialities and generally banal happenings in the sphere of pop culture.

I love the apps for its preselected daily news briefings. I like that it presents me with the headlines and summaries (and nicely done too) of the news of the day, because that's all I have time for. Now I can spend the rest of my free time reading up what matters or interests me.
Straight to the point If you are an Economist subscriber, you will love this app which gives you every morning a 5/10 minutes overview on what is hot in the new political and economic world news.
Keep up the good job! Brilliant app Very good app, couldn't ask for more. Well designed, well delivered, good content. Five stars all in all
Excellent and balanced news. A excellent briefing on the major daily news, without a doubt a great news provide.

Good content Good content, the app should work a bit differently though, preloading the news. If you open it in the tube (ie with no data) you won't be able to read what's essentially 6 micro articles with mini pictures.
Not working. App no longer works. This message pops up: "Something has gone wrong and we are unable to complete the download." Nexus 5 running lollipop.

I like! How much? The app has an intuitive UX, is easy to navigate, and doesn't leave me squinting as I read the content. It's also convenient to be able to download the periodicals at the touch of a finger.
It's fantastic Insightful and brief. A perfect taster of daily news and insight
The best way to follow the news What I wake up to in the morning on most days.
Issues I am still facing issues regarding the app not downloading even after the update
Awesome Brief and informative. It's perfect since sometimes I can't read the entire magazine due to time restrictions, so this app helps a lot for me to keep up with news.
Concise, timely summaries. Well done. The top journalistic organization publishes a daily summary to read with your morning coffee. Well edited, enlightened journalism.
6 stars if it downloaded at set time I don't always have service when I'm ready to read it.

Perfect Daily Digest This is a perfect companion to a subscription of The Economist. It offers a quick take of current events, which is hard to glean from 10-15 minutes with the weekly magazine.Very informative, useful, and easy to use.
Slow download Often have issues downloading - takes ages, won't download at all for an hour etc
Good app, great content. A very nice addition to reading the economist.
Whets ones appetite for more I get the information to decide if I've had enough or if I want to dig deeper into the story.   And often provides links to previous articles.  Love it
Exactly what I Need! It's the perfect way to stay up to date each morning. Complemented by the great writing one can expect from the Economist, it is a wonderful app.
Stay informed - quickly Does exactly what it says on the tin: a brief hit of news to keep you up to date, with links to longer articles for more context.
Great app I subscribe to The Economist and this app is a great addition to their content. A nice little fix of information that I can enjoy while commuting via train to work.
Good app most of the time I don't want to be bombarded with too many long articles, and this app is perfect for keeping up with world affairs in manageable amounts of information
News - concise and bite-sized I enjoy the Espresso app a lot and use it every day. It provides you with the most important pieces of news every day in a concise form.
