Excellent world news app This app is a great way to get world news every day in easily-digestible chunks. The reporting is brief, but of a similar quality level as their longer magazine articles. Though free users can get one of seven daily Espresso articles free per day, paid subscribers to the weekly Economist magazine un...Full ReviewThis app is a great way to get world news every day in easily-digestible chunks. The reporting is brief, but of a similar quality level as their longer magazine articles. Though free users can get one of seven daily Espresso articles free per day, paid subscribers to the weekly Economist magazine unlock all of the Espresso articles every day. I try to read them all during my morning commute, as each days' new edition is usually published by 06:00 GMT.

Updated review I'll leave my previous review below, but they FINALLY fixed the issue that kept me from being able to open the app for several months! I added two stars back, but I do not have a lot of confidence that they will keep the app functioning. ORIGINAL I really enjoy the espresso, when I can read it. I ha...Full ReviewI'll leave my previous review below, but they FINALLY fixed the issue that kept me from being able to open the app for several months! I added two stars back, but I do not have a lot of confidence that they will keep the app functioning. ORIGINAL I really enjoy the espresso, when I can read it. I haven't been able to get it to open for the past three weeks. I don't know why, but this isn't the first time this has happened. The economist needs to put some resources into developing an app that actually works.

Great content, app is improving Love having bite-sized daily updates of news from a credible source. Only six quick snippets, leaves me wanting more. They offer more links to past Economist articles than before, which is a welcome change. The app itself is easy to read and navigate but is clumsy in updating each day's content. Thi...Full ReviewLove having bite-sized daily updates of news from a credible source. Only six quick snippets, leaves me wanting more. They offer more links to past Economist articles than before, which is a welcome change. The app itself is easy to read and navigate but is clumsy in updating each day's content. This has been a problem since its launch; it has improved recently.

Great! Read it most days. Well done to the Economist for meeting a need which I didn't know I had!  A very useful daily update on global issues. Complete opposite of overload from 24/7 news channels. Technical stability still needs to catch up with the editorial quality.

My favorite magazine in the world, app needs stability Everything works as expected 95% of the time. Occasionally two glitches happen thou: Formatting wrong afzer tilting into landscape mode and evrry 20 odd issues i have top reinstall the app because it doesn't download new issues. Very solid the rest of time

Great app, simple to use, relevant global articles. I like to read it after my alarm goes off to wake up a little before getting out of bed. Takes about 5 minutes to get through all the news in the app though. There are links to previous economists articles on the topic if one exists.

Concise express news, perfect As a very busy person I appreciate The Economist, its weekly format allows me to read when I have time, I certainly don't have time for a daily. However, this means I'm always at least a week behind on 'current'  affairs. Espresso is truly consice, fivd minutes and I know what's going on in the worl...Full ReviewAs a very busy person I appreciate The Economist, its weekly format allows me to read when I have time, I certainly don't have time for a daily. However, this means I'm always at least a week behind on 'current'  affairs. Espresso is truly consice, fivd minutes and I know what's going on in the world. As it's The Economist, no populist drivel. Real issues presented on a beautifully designed application.

Not as Biased Doesn't appear as liberally biased as the Economist. Actually useful articles for everyone on the planet, for a change! I don't like the way they offer a free trial. Free should be free, without having to give you my personal and financial information before I know what you are about. Still has a li...Full ReviewDoesn't appear as liberally biased as the Economist. Actually useful articles for everyone on the planet, for a change! I don't like the way they offer a free trial. Free should be free, without having to give you my personal and financial information before I know what you are about. Still has a liberal stench to it, but more suited to people of all walks and the everyday life.

Convenient and insightful I grew up being an Economist reader,  but haven't had the time to get through a magazine in entirety fire quite a while.  Espresso is a more convenient, daily way to get the Economist's insight without having to dedicate to reading the entire publication.

Quick and Informative Espresso gives the day to day grind of what's happening without fluffy language. I don't require opinions just the quick picture of events, I feel I'm receiving quality. A few advertisements - not abrasive.

Extraordinary Content & Support I habitually read the Economist online, for a perspective unavailable in US media, and to reduce recycling and clutter by my reading spot. The app can be slow to load, but that's more of a network infrastructure problem. However, when a prior version invariably hung on my Nexus, I was surprised to s...Full ReviewI habitually read the Economist online, for a perspective unavailable in US media, and to reduce recycling and clutter by my reading spot. The app can be slow to load, but that's more of a network infrastructure problem. However, when a prior version invariably hung on my Nexus, I was surprised to see an actual person listed under "Contact the Developer". I was blown away when I got a reply from that person in a matter of hours, since I'm GMT-7. A new fully functional version rolled out the next day. Wow!

'Articles' too brief to merit the description The 'articles' are far too brief - think sound bites - to be worthwhile they're not regular economist articles. So the free article per day doesn't deliver much at all. So only of relevance to economist subscribers who can treat these pieces as a pr√©cis of the real articles.

1. Content not tailored enough and also inaccurate, e.g. I selected Asia but majority of Saturday articles on Canne festival and Brazil 2. Need to breakdown by political vs business, like in magazine  3. Additional customization, also more articles. Dissappointed by Espresso
One of 2 condensed news apps I use The reading time exactly matches my commute. My thanks to The Economist team who designed it expressly for me. I have yet to experience any glitches with it.

The app is good, but often marks an article as read by itself I use the app as a non-subscriber, so I can choose and read a single article a day (which is then marked with a tick) and then all others are locked. The problem is the app often has an article already marked when I open it, so I am not able to choose the one that interests me. Today it was somethin...Full ReviewI use the app as a non-subscriber, so I can choose and read a single article a day (which is then marked with a tick) and then all others are locked. The problem is the app often has an article already marked when I open it, so I am not able to choose the one that interests me. Today it was something about the eurovision song contest, not at all interesting here from South America.

Freezes on first opening Great news but the app experience is quite bad. App freezes at least for once when opened in the morning. Have to reload to get it to work. Significantly dampens the experience.
Great!  It works again. I really liked this app.  A satisfying fix for a news junky every morning.  Then it stopped working (moto X).  Very disappointing.  Update:  It''s fixed.  I'm happy again.

Quick. Informative. Excellent. I love it. The only thing I would like to see updated is to show the change in currency from the previous day (similar to how the stock index shows the change). But this is being extremely nit-picky.

Best magazine ever Love the economist and the ease of this app, 12 year subscriber, just wish my opinions differed with the magazine a little. Oh except on Israel, typically poor and ill informed reporting.

Good catch up for the day I've given up on news - National radio news is so depressing ; newspapers are so partisan ; everyone wants to tell me what to think. But expresso is in my pocket, simple, brief and honest
Stable app, great content Apps interface is pleasant. Content is high quality. One annoying thing: the app links to full articles on the website, even if I have the app installed. Still recommended
Start my days with it True to the name, Espresso is the first thing I reach for every morning. The format of the news updates is perfect, and it presents just enough information each day.  Love it.
Great app I read it every morning, not massive detail, gives a good overview of issues and takes a short time to read. A good balance of quality vs quantity!

Daily ritual Espresso works. Doesn't crash or become problematic. And the content is extremely valuable to me. My only wish is for the daily content to be downloaded to my device so I can read it even when offline.
Good summary of world events Most issues are very good. But there are still issues with too much sideline news. It's ok to publish a shorter issue when there is no major world news.
Fantastic daily news briefing So much better than local news full of rubbish. If this is all i read each day i feel more up to date than watching tv news or browsing the net.
Great app Really excellent round up of news Monday to Friday. The Saturday output is a little disappointing though, with arts based articles very London centric.

Quick and informative Interesting news stories that can be read in 5min. Tends to always be something different than what you get from skimming a broadsheets website. Adds value to the economist subscription.

Condensed news that matters This is a great way to catch up with the daily news. Some content is so important that you have to be updated about it, other so offbeat that you won't find it anywhere else. Nevertheless, you'll be a lot wiser having read either. Great job.
Good when it works. Decided to try it again after giving up on it because of a freezing problem on my Nexus 9. Looks like they finally fixed it. Now it works perfectly.
functional and informative App is stable and easy to use. Modern interface makes navigating and linking to full articles seamless. Best of all, content meets The Economist standards of quality.

Morning Must Read First thing I do each morning to stay informed on the most important Global issues of the day. Love the quotes too  Great app, I've had no issues opening and getting a message when available.
Best news out there Cuts out the drivel, gives you what you want and need.
Best summary of news! Love the concise news articles. So good when you have no time to read more in depth articles but still feel like you are not missing out on important news!
Fast app with great content Nice way to get caught up on world news each morning. Flicking between articles is speedy. Doesn't overcomplicate things.
Love it! They cover a diverse enough amount of topics that satisfy even those not particularly interested in economics. I couldn't recommend this more.
Perfect bites Smart, succinct news bites to start my day. Love the graphics and reference links to more substantial articles. And then..the quote for the day, which I look forward to. Well done.
Excellent Pity that the pages are not centred on my tablet Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.5: some of the top image remains off screen. Adverts load just fine.

The world in brief us my favorite I really appreciate Espresso's rich, informed content and its fast-paced, concise format. I could do with a little less of the cheeky punchlines that punctuate many of the stories.

Stable, easy to use, unintrusive ads I'm a subscriber and love the full app, including audio of articles, this app is just as good with excellent bite sized reminders of each days stories of interest. Timely in delivery, even in Australia time zones..

Exactly what youre looking for Its a good place to start learning more about the patterns in economies and general policy around the world. The length of the articles are good cause you get a quick preview of whats happening then u can decide to do more research on the subject later if you want. which isnt necessary because these...Full ReviewIts a good place to start learning more about the patterns in economies and general policy around the world. The length of the articles are good cause you get a quick preview of whats happening then u can decide to do more research on the subject later if you want. which isnt necessary because these bite sized reports tend to give an informative overview.
Great app I use this app every morning, and it's great, especially since I traded my S3 in for an S6. No problems freezing or crashing anymore!

Perfect companion to the Economist Brief snippets with just a bit of supporting data suffices to whet the appetite. In a few cases the report is too similar to a more comprehensive Economist article, but this does not detract from a useful and focussed app, much better than simple aggregators.

A great start to the day Espresso is a nifty application, and compliments my weekly Economist with fresh snippets of news each morning over breakfast. Worth downloading, but remember to empty its cache files now and then as they do accumulate.

Something to look forward to each morning Great app. Works well technically. And there is a great deal of information about diverse current topics, in short form,  each day, along with helpful links to longer articles in the Economist.

Short and sweet--just how I like it Great for the person who might not have a lot of time in the morning to read many full-length articles about the day biggest headlines. Additionally enjoyable as these stories come from an economics perspective. Good stuff.
A daily spoonful of the world Each morning I can sip espresso while reading Espresso. I always gain insight into at least one event or trend that I had not previously considered.
A morning routine. I made it a habit to read economist espresso first thing in the morning. Relevant and filtered news and is worth reading!
Great Daily News digest I enjoy daily reading the snarky, smart commentary on the day's news delivered by the Economist's expert team. Great, snappy way to start the day!
My favorite way to start the day The only complaint I can think of is that there is no Sunday edition.

The premise of the app might be swell hut the fact that I'm being prompted to buy a subscription every 30 seconds is bothering.  I myself am a media professional and understand that the free online content model can't sustain. But then again, no need to masquerade the app as free.

The Fantastic Espresso (Corto) Gives a great brief on world news and is the prefect coffee-buddy. The app has been running smoothly for more than a year and keeps me updated every day. The news is well written and varied, covering all the major present topics.

Helpful tool for Economics studies The Espresso app is a handy and convenient tool for me. I read it as I have breakfast or when commuting to college. It gives a balanced and concise roundup of news in economics, politics and business and has supplemented my wider knowledge that is needed for my Economics and Geography A Level.
Please allow customization I love this app, the only thing I think could be done to improve it would be to enable users to follow their own stocks indices and currency prices
Essential Along with email, this is the only app I feel like I need to use every day. Excellent rundown of global news. A must-have.

Economist Espresso Love this app. A quick way for busy people to catch up on the main international headlines every day. Also great for people who don't like reading long drawn-out articles. Espresso gives you just the crunch!
Short digest that I use regularly Handy digest that I find more convenient than the full Economist weekly.  Useful links to full articles and short enough to read over breakfast.

Mostly harmless I like both The Economist and the Economist Espresso app. Six days a week Espresso presents a seven page summary of world news and markets, that takes under ten minutes to read. It works well on both Android and iOS devices. My only, minor, quibble is that it assumes the screen is in portrait orient...Full ReviewI like both The Economist and the Economist Espresso app. Six days a week Espresso presents a seven page summary of world news and markets, that takes under ten minutes to read. It works well on both Android and iOS devices. My only, minor, quibble is that it assumes the screen is in portrait orientation.
A disappointing app with only 1 free mini article a day. Not worth the money to subscribe.
Really good app but can be better Crashes sometimes or takes a long time to open.
Needs a manual refresh Every day when I open the app to read the new issue, it gives an error that it could not load new content, and I have to manually refresh, which works instantly
The most important news I read this every day before work and it gives me a summary of the most important things happening. It's great
Bite sized and informative Ideal for time poor people with a lust for world news and who don't care about the Kardashians
Great Insights in a great package Easy to use, excellent writing as expected from The Economist

Well rounded news summary I like the daily news summary from around the world - it's well written, with beautiful pictures and a simple UI. Also, it's not pretentious in the writing and neither is it like the scores of tabloid summaries on news portals, auto created from syndicated feeds.
Good Mix of Real News Like the Economist itself, Espresso contains a good mix of world and business news but in bite-sized chunks so I can keep up-to-date. No celebrity nonsense either.
Stupid app never finishes downloading Surprisingly inefficient for an Economist product. What is the point of updating to deliver a poorer quality experience?

Good brief Economist's view on five stories of international significance plus very short summary of what important happened the day before.  Some indices and exchange rates topped off by an interesting quote.  Worth five minutes in the morning.
Pradeep Chhajerh Short, crisp and informative. Writing style makes reading enjoyable.
Stopped working Read it every day and feel connected to our world.
Good way to start the day.  Some glitches remain, but are being fixed.
Great way to keep up to date Getting the international news highlights has never been so easy!
World news snapshot A great complement to the magazine. Daily snapshot of news stories and financial information. Useful and informative.

Love the app, but it has an annoying bug: you can't swipe to the second article from the ad after the first article. You have to either return to the menu or start with the last article and swipe left until you reach the first. Please fix it!
Essential reading Its a great selection of bite sized news stories and commodity and currency prices first thing in the morning. Essential reading esp for those with limited time.

Good... Like the app Great concise summaries, entirely consistent with the quality I expect from The Economist. As a paid subscriber to the regular magazine, I agree that my Espresso should be ad-free.
Great content, elegant app Terrific world news summary and analysis, in a well designed package.

NMcW Topical, informative, easy to read, always up-date, a great early-morning digest. Occasional bugs on the market data, but otherwise a well thought out produduct. All round very good. My first read of the day.
Good summary of news It's good, but I wish it also had a page of 2-3 links of must read links from other places, like the quartz daily newspaper.
Informative Great content delivered right to your phone each morning.
Read it every day One of the apps I use most. Hugely informative and enlightening. Look forward to it every morning it comes out.
Short News Bites Articles that provide news feeds about topics not normally seen in traditional media.

The Right Amount of News Perfect cross-section of news from around the world, with enough depth to develop a real understanding of what is really going on.  Ends with a quote and poof, gone until tomorrow.

Great news summary on the go An old review, but the quality has only increased since. The quality journalism of the Economist in an easy to digest format. The free service is still interesting, but the premium service is where the value is.
Great content sluggish app I love the condensed version everyday but the loading is sometimes slow
Lovely Morning Briefing I love waking up to read the Espresso's morning briefing. Great selection of hand-curated stories from around the world to start your day!
Easy & quick to read Saves me reading the weekly mag.... which I regret, actually.
Best news digest This is the first thing I read when my eyes open.
Does the job Simple, effective application provided a useful morning news summary.
Great way to wake up Tells you a little bit about what is going on in the world every day. A great complement to the weekly magazine.
What's up with all this add thingy? The app is great, 5 stars actually, but why should I have adds (microsoft, samsung) when I am paying monthly for the service?
Great app I use this more than the actual economist magazine due to the brevity - also, the daily nature means it is more current. I also enjoy the witty quotes at the end of each issue.
Way too brief The articles and even the summary page is way too brief considering the source. Trying too hard.

Great summary of the world's news I have been a subscriber for several months, and I depend on it for my international news. Great reporting with minimal journalistic interpretation, it is The Economist distilled for daily consumption.
New update makes for near perfect app Now that there is an alert in the status bar, this is has become a morning news staple for me.  Really drives the value of the Economist subscription.

Great way to get info Great way to get world news delivered to you on the daily. Would recommend especially if you still want to be informed but don't have time to listen to the radio or watch the news.
Daily Updates As a subscriber, the week is covered in detail by the main publication, but this ensures you don't miss anything and can be more 'news' centric as things unfold.
Excellent news app First thing I do is read the espresso in the morning. Informative, concise, and good analysis.
Great start to the day Provides a number of short articles that mirror longer articles in the weekly edition, and a very useful world "in brief" highlighting notable current-ish events.
Fabulous Start every day with it.  Offers a more or less neutral observation on global issues
Update broke it! The stories are informative and provocative.
Love it Just the facts, minus all the crap. Great for people without time or patience.
Well produced app, very good format for mobile I read this every single day. A much needed improvement would be to load the day's stories in the background
Read it every day I enjoy a curated list, rather than one where the most popular goes to the top.
Nice way to start the day. A daily selection of important topics. More than a soundbite, but less than reading a full article. I like the references included with each item.
Love it I like to have a quick overview of some of the top goings-on in the world. It's a nice way to orient myself without getting lost in a full newspaper.
Quick satisfying update As with the newspaper, the editors reliably pick unique, relevant items to enjoy in a spare 5 minutes
Great morning briefing The Economist does a good job of serving up a useful, curated group of articles each morning. And the app itself presents it in a clear manner.
Solid app Excelent app, good job overall. In my opinion one improvement could be to automatic reset the screen timeout to a larger period while reading an article.
New part of the morning ritual Fantastic and informative rundown of the world's most important stories. Espresso had quickly become a part of my morning routine.
A quick read of the latest major political,  econimic and business news around the world. Great app.
Great Great snippet of the world in 24 hours. Please reduce the typos though.
Espresso Bite-sized chunks of news, not always the mainstream stories either, ideal for somebody like me who struggles to read a newspaper every day.
Great I love the economist and I like the way it lets me read just a little bit every morning.
A good daily world digest. Enough to keep you informed about matters you might otherwise know nothing about
Easy and Useful No bells and whistles here, and that's a good thing! Extremely easy to use, well written articles, and it is quick to get though in the morning.
Daily news shot I love small doze of short articles. It is part of my life now. Hardly a day goes by without me reading it
Convenient news sound bites Some of the links out don't always work but otherwise really good
Good layout The concept to provide updates based on current events is really good. It's one of the few apps I check on a daily basis.
Read every day Best app to start the day with news. Would like to see a customizable last slide so you can choose specific stocks to watch.
Great app Haven't had any issues with it. Provides a great summary of what's going on
Best news digest! Use everyday to get the news digest first thing in the morning. Brilliant app!
Good morning read This app brings you just the right amount of news first thing in the morning in an easy to digest format.
The best app I have come across Use it every morning to quickly get up to speed on key news. Intelligent, thoughtful, and concise.
A good summary of news highlights This is a good way to start out the day. The articles are a quick summary of important events in the world and I also like the market summary.
Best early - day news recap I read Espresso daily for a quick, well-written recap of global news. This is the only daily news app you need.
Short and sweet Easy to use, unobtrusive ads (though I'm not sure why there are ads on something you need a paid subscription to use).

author_name: S A T I R I N O Ian Malkin
review_body: Super app Perfect length for a quick early morning news read, always well written. Love the last page daily quote!
My favourite news app! Espresso is my favourite go-to morning news app.  Well-designed, easy to navigate, and a great complement to the magazine's solid content.
Tom from Glasgow Helpful highlights in a succinct style plus things you didn't know were happening. Keeps you ahead.
Handy, fast, informative. The app works smoothly and the content provides a good, quick summary of events of the day. An unexpected highlight of my Economist subscription.
Quality morning read This is a good app with well thought out, relevant content in an easy to digest format. A good start to the day!
short and sweet I read every story.  I often wish for more stories and depth but that's OK, I can then do that.  this is my first read of the morning.
Best way to start the morning When most news aggregators continue to slide into echo chambers, a researched news source to start my day is essential.
Espresso Cuts The Economist's customary classy delivery to the quick to produce a valuable and informative tour d'horizon. Essential part of my day.
Economisy Expresso Better to start the day with a blend of my favotie caffeine AND a few well chosen topics/words from The Economist team
Great complement to the morning coffee Loads fast, glitch free, works as intended and gives an easily digestible overview of topical issues
Good start to my morning I love the feel/flow of the app and the info is well condensed. I always look forward to my morning subway commute!
A great app Ideal summary of news to wake up to.
Perfect alongside other news apps.  A good way to wake up the brain in the morning!
Brilliantly brief Perfectly succinct and broad in topics covered. Would recommend this to anyone who wants to inject current affairs into a busy life :)
Timely, direct, digestible A welcomed and readily-consumable touch on high points of global political and economic developments.
Great app Updates have improved the app's reliability. As a new source it is one of the best
I read it every day This is a great little app. it gives me a quick overview of what has happened in the world in the last few days.
Exactly what I need to start a day. Five major news, a markets overview, and a random short news; easily read while drinking a coffee.
A great  daily news brief Highly informative and concise.  Works wonderfully for my commute to work. Occasionally, the app has bugs loading.
Crisp and eclectic In five minutes, highlights from across the globe with briefing. It's indeed small and strong like a cup of espresso.
Great app It's a great way to actually get a shot of the news in the morning. Would highly recommend it to anyone with an interest in what's going on in the world.
The Economist at its best, short & opinionated
Great way to start the day informed Reliable app with global content to get a snapshot of trending news. Love the arts addition on Saturday.
Too concise I enjoy the app. The articles could be a little longer to allow for some context and there could be more of them. The layout is good.
Great global morning news summary Just the right mix of global news storys for a quick read over a cup of coffee before getting started in the morning.
Kati Great summary of the world's news every week day. Complements the weekly edition well. Love the daily quote at the end too.
The start of my day It gives me a very brief summary of what's going on in the world every morning. Great app.
Works well Concise, well-rounded summary of events for the day with key financial data. The qoute at the end is a nice touch.
Excellent summary Great to keep informed of things happening today with summary analysis
Great, if you subscribe A brilliant little app that brings an interesting selection of short articles every morning.
Clean and Intuitive Great way to quickly catch up on news in the morning, the simple swipe navigation feels natural and fast.
I enjoy it with my morning coffee A good daily update on things that matter.
Exactly what it says Short news delivered in an easy to use app. Perfect!
Really good and accessable version of The Economist Bite size well written briefs - easily selectable text size really helps
Brilliant and concise Great for concise, well written articles to get one somewhat up to speed in the important things happening
Very useful The downloading issues have been resolved. Very solid app.
Great content everyday!
Still crashing I love this app!
Best News Ap Quick, highly impactful shots of world news. Worth every penny and much more!
Concise and insightful Content is what I would expect from the Economist. As a subscriber for 30 years I look forward to reading what the Economist has to say.
Fantastic app Concise update of world news in just a couple of minutes. You expect the best from the Economist and the espresso delivers
The perfect spritz The Economist Espresso does an excellent job of highlighting the most important topics of the year/month /week.
Succinct & informative If you enjoy the Economist's perspective & insight, this app is a great way to start your day.
Early morning news shot Simple and we'll designed app that allows a quick shot of early morning news  (Economist subscription required)
Great Summaries It is very useful for a morning brief of what is going on in the world.
A daily shot of global news... In the time it takes to down an espresso,  delivered in a UF format.
Solid app Would like an additional article with brief summaries and comment on regional news (driven by a selection in settings)
The whole world's headlines in a nutshell. It's great for staying on top of the news in today's fast changing world.
Great summary for day A little slow to load
Works well on Android Works well on Android tablet, total disaster on Ipad. Nice add-on to Economist paper.
Would like to be able to edit the data shown in the "markets and currencies" session to reflect my own - and especially local - needs
Informative wakeup read. Glad the opening bug was fixed.
Lots of wisdom in 10 minutes everyday ! Very informative & brief reporting. Helps gather the important events from the day in 10-15 minutes.
Perfect news app This is all I ever wanted, the quality of the Economist but in bite size pieces.
A daily habit I read it daily, it keeps me aware of the world in a light, often humorous way.  Love it!
Great Morning quick read I love that the espresso come as a reminder on my phone. It is a great update for the morning.
This is my morning paper This is an excellent way to get a sharp  and sometimes witty overview of the previous day's headlines.
Just what you need to know about what's going on in the world, I read it every morning over my coffee!
Recommended! Just the right amount of information for the morning. Selection is very balanced. My preferred way to get up to date in the morning.
Glad it's working again The update to the update to the update seems to have done the trick. Happy to have my morning glimpse of the world back.
Good product Quick overview of the news while I finish my morning coffee. I enjoy having it every day.
Better than the website Clean slick app. Goes someway to making up for the world's slowest, clunkiest website
Daily dose of useful information Relevant , short, to the point ... The three main characteristics of the espresso , enjoy reading it everyday
First Time User Its great to learn about what is going on globally and get a first hand taste of it in the early morning.
A great addition to the Economist publications I consider Espresso to be a first rate summary of important news items.
Rarely works I had this app for over a year; it rarely works. Finally giving up and uninstalling.
The Name says it all A shot of concentrated news and analysis to lift me into the day ahead.
It's very nice to read, well designed and formatted. Great for short subway trips without service.
A great mini news app Exactly what I need every morning to understand what's going on in the world!
Great content, good app Just a bit slow
Less is more Like the proverbial sexy skirt - long  enough to cover the essentials and short enough to keep the attention.
Good Summary Short articles makes it easy to read and recollect. Good job. Some are elaborated oh the weekly edition later.
Great content on a daily basis Informative and relevant news and views in TE's no-nonsense style.
Great app! I like the way that this app presents just a small handful of short articles each day.
Daily News Briefs Nice way to catch up with the world each morning. Clever writing as expected from the Economist.
Bite size Economist I enjoy reading these few articles each day. The brevity is great.
Beautiful This app is clean and useful!
Nicely working app! Great news, great timing everyday and very good user interface.
Occasional hiccups, but the content is always excellent.
Helpful Great dose of news each morning when you want to catch up on major headlines in 5 minutes
Indispensable Aptly named. Concise daily newsfeed, essential reading first thing.
Nifty, neat and never late. Excellent app that condenses all the worlds events into seven sections.
Occasionally links to related articles fail to load, otherwise a great app
good app quick and small. further reading article links should link to the economist app not the website
Pills of news A very useful app to get the indispensable news of the day, by the expert team of The Economist
Quick way to be updated on news For someone who has little free time, this app is great!
Great start to every day My morning dose of economist views on the world is already an essential to each day.
Excellent news A great way to keep tabs on the key news day by day without having to read a whole paper
Mac Puts the information I need at my fingertips each morning.
Perfect.  A daily run down with links to full stories fir those that get the Economist weekly.
The onlt thing i pay for
Excellent daily update Quick read over breakfast, with a wider world view
Short and sweet Nice and informative way to stay the day
Great way to start the day I really enjoy reading the issue while commuting to work. Great job.
Great App! Love starting my day with a shot of news. The Economist delivers again!
Great bitesize news Nicely laid out and easy to swipe through with the thumb on the way to work.
Good mix of news The additonal links at the bottom they've added in are helpful and insightful at times
Very good Great overview of things going on around the world. Perfect length.
Perfect Format The length of the articles is perfect for a quick read in the morning before work begins.
Nice daily summary Medium length articles on five topics with daily news summary. Good mix to start the day.
A good balance of detail and breadth Light touch, remarkable detail. Part of the daily learning curve.
Great and reliable. Never fails.  Great way to get the news.  And economist content is top-notch, of course.
World class reporting, condensed Read it over your coffee. Coffee makes Espresso better, and Espresso makes your coffee better. :-)
Delivers interesting information in easy to use app.
Super convenient This is probably the fastest and most convenient way to stay on top of current relevant news.
My morning news I read it six mornings a week
Quick info to start the day Information is well presented in a simple, but elegant app.
Slow to load at times.
Good Images especially are cropped on Galaxy Tab s2 8.0 because of 3x4 aspect ratio.
Look forward to Espresso every morning Perfect, bite sized analytical news stories.
Top! Exactly what I need to start my day in the 10 minutes that I have available.
Precise and just the right amount,  a news based "amuse-bouche" at the start of the day.
Great condensed daily Love The Economist and now it has a daily version . . . what's not to like?
5 minutes to become the king of office watercolor chitchat
It's great. Can you add narration like the magazine has? Would be great for the commute.
An easy way to get a morning dose of the Economist A nice app that never crashes
This is my source of news practically every day. Excellent reporting in a bite sized form.
New Reader MBA Student Love this app! Content is spot-on for my needs.
Fantastic sized articles The name says it all. A small shot of rich news.
Great app! Great app to keep up to date on global developments in a few minutes each morning.
Great news app! Simple quick and comprehensive daily updates, clean design and fun!
Great news app Seamless transitions to other relevant Economist content very nice!
Convenient and fast This app is perfect for a quick 10 minute read of the days news.
Clear, concise and relevant snapshot of what is going on in the world that I can digest in 5 minutes
Just the perfect sized dose... Great short synopsis of daily economic and political news.
Great start to the day An ideal dose of international news for those on the go in the morning.
Great App Wonderful way to keep up on the important global news from a trusted source.
Excellent to start your day Just the brief you'd want in the morning. I love it.
Focused A perfect way to quickly get up to date on the top news of the day.
Informative, quick, and easy Best way to know what you need to start your day.
Best place for world news summary everyday Part of my daily routine now.
Great At times it can take a while to loaf the content, otherwise its great
Great app Works great on Nexus 6. Really enjoy the app. Solid content. Perfect breakfast news app
Economust Great, quick, daily briefing! Essential for keeping up when time is limited.
I love it!  A bite sized morsel of the Economist for breakfast every morning.
Solid Good international business news, boiled down to the essentials for a quick read.
Great overview! Excellent overview of what's going on in the world on this day. I start every day by reading this.
Economist Espresso Morning news notes from the Economist magazine.
As a summary...its the best! A well worthwhile 5 minutes every day
First news of the day My daily starter.
Daily new shot A very nice way to get your daily shot of news.
Simple, effective, efficient Economy in design and laconic in its length. Perfect in my mind.
Perfect start to my day I love the well-curated brief stories.
Is like having breakfast in bed!
Great way to start the day Easy way to get quick economic news updates every day.
World's best news source, and the format of Espresso is a perfect briefing template.
Great digest, flakey download experience
Useful and informative Provides a great overview of world events, it's clear and digestible.

Could offer even more condensed readings and the app is missing features on android First of all I would say that this service is very good. It is worth the price of subscription, especially on iOS (iPhone). Two things could be better: 1) You could offer a super condensed summary in one/two bullets on the top of each article. This is usually done in Bloomberg Business articles onli...Full ReviewFirst of all I would say that this service is very good. It is worth the price of subscription, especially on iOS (iPhone). Two things could be better: 1) You could offer a super condensed summary in one/two bullets on the top of each article. This is usually done in Bloomberg Business articles online, and is very useful. 2) I often used dictionary in the app on iOS and for me it was a big disappointment to see that you can not click/mark words for copy in the android app.

Great idea; much improved execution I had technical issues with a previous version, but updates seem to have eliminated them (Moto G, 3rd gen). This is a terrific app; nicely designed, and imo The Economist's content is hard to beat. The addition of a "less-newsy" Saturday edition is also fun.

Really Just Like Digital Coffee This is truly a very informative and quick way to get briefed and ready for the day... even if you don't read any other news, it's a great way for me to catch up daily. Works reliably on my tablet and phone too.

Double notification bug Edit: bug is fixed. Great now. Each morning I get two notifications telling me that the daily edition is available. Each has a different icon in my notification bar. Why does this developer continue to push changes without proper QA?

Very good in spite of bugs Daily succinct news coverage of things that matter, great for a busy life full of distracting celebrity media. Bugginess is quickly becoming the trademark of Economist apps, keeping it from a higher rating. Still a very useful app that I recommend for those who care about the goings on in the world.

Pint size news The pint size daily overview of global news is a perfect fit for people with busy schedules. I only wish it was published 7 x / wk as opposed to 6. I also enjoy the artsy Saturday version since i quickly peruse news that i would otherwise not read.

Concise daily news digest!! Have been using this app for a while now. Very handy keeping you up to date with what's going on around the world. The news snippets are to the point and picks the key issues. The app interface is very user friendly and simple to use. A must have app !! Highly recommended.

Great app. Great content. Even works great on my most troublesome devices. Excellent five minutes of content to start the day. It has immediately become part of my morning... routine (euphemism) to Facebook's demise. I'm sure I'm not the only one.

The Perfect News Digest This app is the perfect digest of daily news.  It represents everything I have learned to expect from The Economist in terms of accurate reporting. Unfortunately this app has been plagued with some programming and display issues.
Not really fully awake until I've read it This is totally subjective. I've subscribed to the Economist for over 30 years, so getting a little bit every morning is, for me, just cool.
Works perfectly always. Should add exact time and date for each market or commodity; at close is meaningless. Quotes of the day are time wasters, many not particularly good.
Wonderful, when it works It's a well designed app with a great summary of the news. They seem to have fixed many of the bugs. I no longer have the connectivity issues that plagued me months ago.
Great content, but the app is wobbly A very useful potted summary of the world's news with comment. The app currently works fine, but it often crashes and has other problems

Espresso Double Shot I really like this app!!! Timely news and insights summarized to a bitesize digest. A realistic direction of journalism led by the Economist. Great job. The Economist's view of the world is indeed very sensible and insightful. The addition of the weekend Science, Art, and Culture briefs are like Lat...Full ReviewI really like this app!!! Timely news and insights summarized to a bitesize digest. A realistic direction of journalism led by the Economist. Great job. The Economist's view of the world is indeed very sensible and insightful. The addition of the weekend Science, Art, and Culture briefs are like Latte or Mocha - rich and tasteful. Such a delight. A must have app.
Great daily updates This app is near flawless. Only very infrequent issues with getting todays news, but I hardly notice it.
Liked the app but‚Ä¶ it stopped working. White screen on Nexus 10 even after repeated restarts.

Much improved It used to be slow to load. But now it is easy, readable, focussed, and useful. It could be slightly expanded to increase range. But it is fundamentally a refreshing and efficient news start to the day. Always works.
Now with ad-annoyance The ads are slightly too much. But the content is excellent.
Bite sized Same writing as the Economist,  but condensed and more timely.  A nice daily summery. Does occasionally crash or take a while to load though.

Content rules App works well enough. It's the snippets of liberal market thinking that are useful (that's not a political endorsement). I could do without the halfhearted quotes at the end of each edition.

Concise articles One thing I like most about this app is concise and to the point articles. It gives you a glimpse of what's going on in the world without making you read 2000 words on just one of the subjects, as WSJ does.
Economist Espresso Very informative. Only downside: market data information inexplicably unreliable sometimes. Fix that or remove it; the rest is outstanding.

Great App! Love the design. The short news bits are always informative, yet concise enough to be brief. Indeed it reads like an espresso in the morning. Also have enjoyed the culture section on Saturdays.
Lousy on tablet Pictures are cut off on my tab s 8.4.  When I complained they said app was optimized for phones. As a retired coder I find that to be a really weak excuse.
Espresso has become a daily habit! First thing in the morning news briefing. I love everything The Economist does!

New (4/2016) review: They've put effort and money into the app and it shows. Great news variety and coverage, and they mostly get their stock ticker correct.  Old review:... but the service isn't. They have a built-in feedback system that is deeply flawed, I've used it several times and they always ...Full ReviewNew (4/2016) review: They've put effort and money into the app and it shows. Great news variety and coverage, and they mostly get their stock ticker correct.  Old review:... but the service isn't. They have a built-in feedback system that is deeply flawed, I've used it several times and they always come back telling me "we don't see that you're a subscriber to our magazine", apparently they just can't figure out they have more than one service/revenue stream. And the issue I keep asking them about is their app's failure to properly update the performance of the S&P. It's pretty basic, I've prompted them 3 times now, and they've done nothing nor have they responded. Meh.

A quick read News in this form offers a succinct quick read that is usually effective, although not all the articles interest me and on the odd occasion I didn't grasp the remarks made. The world in brief is good. Unlike another reviewer I generally like quote of the day. Please put a conversion from GBP to EUR ...Full ReviewNews in this form offers a succinct quick read that is usually effective, although not all the articles interest me and on the odd occasion I didn't grasp the remarks made. The world in brief is good. Unlike another reviewer I generally like quote of the day. Please put a conversion from GBP to EUR so there is a visibly instant comparison with GBP to USD.
Quick update to start the day I don't always have time to read the long form weekly, so this does a good job of covering the essentials and pointing me to in-depth articles when I want them.
Great news summary I really like this app, you can get caught up with the day while you're still waking up.
News Junkie Espresso is the 1st thing I read every AM.  Focused, brief and timely - just like the Economist.
Update broken! The update installed today just crashes instantly when opened!
Short and effective Doesn't take much time to read and gives a good picture of the world. I love the quote at the end
8 minutes read Relevant non-gossipy news, crisp and objective all packed in an 8 minutes read. Good for attention deficit prone people like me. :)
Freezes upon opening Started to freeze intermittently upon opening a few weeks ago.  After new update, app is unable to open at all.
Clever little app. Gives you a few things to think about every morning without taking hours of your time.

Essential. Enjoy 5 topics of content and analysis each morning that are expertly crafted into ~150 words. Get a glimpse of "The world in brief" and key market indicators. The interface is refined and focused: this app is for reading and that is (thankfully) about all it does. My subscription to The Economist s...Full ReviewEnjoy 5 topics of content and analysis each morning that are expertly crafted into ~150 words. Get a glimpse of "The world in brief" and key market indicators. The interface is refined and focused: this app is for reading and that is (thankfully) about all it does. My subscription to The Economist started with this app. Yours might too.

A refreshing news app The wonder of the espresso is how it is boiled down, leaving only the substance of importance. The Economist manages this perfectly. Having a finite amount of articles to read, it gives a sense of fulfillment upon finishing, as if you have read all meaningful news there is for the day.
Short sweet news I get up early. Seriously early. The bright light of the espresso app both wakes me up AND informs me about the day's events!

Reliable, Functional, and Beautiful The Espresso app by the Economist is a great app to get that daily quick fix of what's going on in the world. It does what it promises in an aesthetically pleasing interface and, I think, adds value with the little touches such as the market overview and quote of the day.
First thing I read every day,  except Sunday Great 5 minute summary of the world
Very useful and we'll written digest. It's the first thing I read every morning.
Best news app Concise, informative, and user-friendly. This Economist app is well designed and I use it everyday to catch up on news during my commute

Fabulous Great way to get morning round up in 5minutes. Basically a mini-Economist, which is a great supplement to the main paper and can keep me more abreast with headlines, whilst providing deeper insight than BBC.
Good app and great content App that provides the latest headlines at one place. App hangs sometimes, but the content makes up for it.

My day doesn't start without it It provides great summary of the leading news with a nice outlook. And I love the quotation at the end of each edition. I also like that there are links to other articles with bigger analysis.
Great daily focused updates. I find myself motivated to read it through so I can see the daily quote. Odd, but it works!

Update affected function Worked fine before update. Still not working as of December 1st uninstall/reinstall.-------------------Updating this some 16 months later... Back in business! All is well in the world and Economist is there to report on it.

They allow you to form your op...Full ReviewAt a time when so-called journalists cannot fact check, let alone write a coherent paragraph.  This is a much better written and factual publication than anything written in the US media.  They write facts in the articles not how the writer thinks the facts should be. I like The Economist. I just don't have time to read a whole issue each week. This app does the job, but not really well.  For those of you who are familiar with the print edition, this resembles the "News in Brief," but with a bias toward finance and business news. They recently added a Saturday is...Full ReviewI like The Economist. I just don't have time to read a whole issue each week. This app does the job, but not really well.  For those of you who are familiar with the print edition, this resembles the "News in Brief," but with a bias toward finance and business news. They recently added a Saturday issue that tries to make up for this bias, but I'm not entirely satisfied.  This app is also not very good software. It is also annoyingly slow to load (10 seconds or so). Considering that I don't get to this app for a few hours after the day's issue is actually published, this is inexplicable. One day recently, I couldn't get the day's issue at all until the next day. There's also been a persistent issue with the reporting of market indices.

Worth a free trial, but I am unsure about paying $3.99 Canadian a month (current price for me) for seven slides of information a day. If there was an option to pay a little bit more to get a lot more content in this app, I would be willing to pay.

Good app with drawbacks Its a brief Economist style daily designed to read faster than a newspaper. Considering its free with a standard digital subscription it's a decent app. The Economist offers a new morning radio show at an additional monthly charge. in my opinion the radio show should come with the digital subscripti...Full ReviewIts a brief Economist style daily designed to read faster than a newspaper. Considering its free with a standard digital subscription it's a decent app. The Economist offers a new morning radio show at an additional monthly charge. in my opinion the radio show should come with the digital subscription, as the Economist is not cheap. This app seems to be a compromisable middle ground. I do wish the app offered the voice readout audio feature that the standard weekly Economist app has but oh well.

Great way to start your day This app is really amazing. I love reading the economist every week but sometimes it is a little too dense for "I just woke up" reading. This is perfect because it is great news in a format that is easy to understand quick to read. I love it.
